name: Quick Meditations (5-10 Minutes)
description: Short, accessible meditation practices for busy lives. Perfect for building a daily habit without overwhelm.

exercises.name: 5-Minute Breath Awareness
exercises.description: Simple focus on breathing - perfect beginner meditation
exercises.instructions: Sit comfortably. Close eyes. Notice your natural breath. When mind wanders, gently return to breath. No judgment, just notice.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Morning routine, work breaks, building meditation habit
exercises.guidedOption: Can use app like Headspace/Calm for guidance

exercises.name: Morning Intention Setting (5min)
exercises.description: Start the day with clarity and purpose
exercises.instructions: Sit quietly. Take 3 deep breaths. Ask: What matters most today? What's one thing I can let go of? Sit with whatever arises.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Morning routine, before checking phone, with coffee
exercises.journalPrompt: Optional: write down what came up

exercises.name: Quick Body Check-In (5min)
exercises.description: Scan body for tension, release what you can
exercises.instructions: Sit or lie down. Breathe naturally. Notice: jaw tension? Shoulders tight? Belly held? Soften each area as you notice it.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Desk breaks, after workouts, evening wind-down
exercises.adhdFriendly: Shorter than full body scan, more accessible

exercises.name: Gratitude Practice (5min)
exercises.description: Shift perspective by focusing on what's working
exercises.instructions: Sit comfortably. Bring to mind 3 things you're grateful for today. Can be tiny (warm shower) or big (health). Feel the appreciation.
benefits: Shifts from scarcity to abundance mindset
exercises.bestUsedFor: Difficult days, before bed, when feeling stuck
exercises.scienceBacked: Gratitude practice proven to improve wellbeing and sleep

exercises.name: Walking Meditation (10min)
exercises.description: Mindful movement - perfect for those who struggle sitting still
exercises.instructions: Walk slowly indoors or outdoors. Feel each foot lifting, moving, placing. Notice body movement. When mind wanders, return to sensation of walking.
exercises.bestUsedFor: When restless, garden/nature walks, phone-free time
exercises.adhdFriendly: Movement helps focus, easier than sitting meditation
